Integration_System__Audited_Object.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Integration_System__Audited_ObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Integration_System__Audited_Object.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Integration_Service_Component_Override_D.description: If the Override Fields below pertain to the EIB's Data Source, mark this boolean TRUE.
If the Override Fields below pertain to the EIB's Transformation, mark this boolean TRUE.
If the Override Fields below pertain to the EIB's File Utility (e.g. transport Payload), mark this boolean TRUE.
If the Override Fields below pertain to the EIB's Transport Protocol, mark this boolean TRUE.

Integration_Service_Component_Field_Over.description: The Name of the Field for corresponding Service Component.  This will be a unique identifier for looking up the appropriate Field.

validation.validation:
The Field Name "[field]" is not valid for [int system] and this section of the Launch EIB request.

Valid Fields for [section] section are:
[field labels]
validation.description: Field Name must be valid for EIB and this section (e.g. Data Source, Transformation, File Utility, Transport Protocol) of the Launch EIB request.

validation.validation: The Override Field "[field]", whose return type is "[work data att][work data inst][enum class]", expects the appropriate attribute/instance element to be populated within the Field Override Data subelement.
validation.description: The Override Field expects the appropriate attribute/instance element to be populated within the Field Override Data subelement.

validation.validation: Attachment Data subelement is only allowed within the request when the Override Field accepts an Integration Attachment (e.g. within a Data Source service component).
validation.description: Attachment Data subelement is only allowed within the request when the Override Field accepts an Integration Attachment (e.g. within a Data Source service component).

validation.validation: The Override Field "[field]", whose return type is "[work data att][work data inst]", expects the appropriate return type from the External Field Reference.  The External Field "[ext field]" returns a data type of "[ext field data type att][ext field data type inst]" instead.
validation.description: External Field reference must return a data type that is comparable to the Override Field's data type.

validation.validation: The External Field reference "[ext field]" is valid for the "[bus object]" business object.  It must be executable off of the Integration System business object, or it must be a Global, static field.  Also, it must be accessible by the processing user.
validation.description: External Field reference must be executable off of the Integration System business object, or it must be a Global, static field.  Also, it must be accessible by the processing user.

Integration_Service_Component_Field_Over.description: To specify a specific value, populate this element.

Integration_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Filename of the Attachment.
Text attribute identifying Encoding of the Attachment.
Boolean attribute identifying whether the Attachment is compressed.
Text attribute identifying a unique ID for Attachment.

Mime_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Mime_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Mime_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Integration_Attachment_Data.description: Reference element identifying a unique instance of Content Type of the Attachment.

Integration_Service_Component_Field_Over.description: To create and assign an Attachment to the Field, populate this element.

External_FieldObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

External_FieldObjectID.type: WID,  Calculated_Field_ID,  Computed_Data_Source_Field_ID,  Custom_Field_Data_Set_ID,  Custom_Field_ID,  Extension_Computed_Data_Field_Reference_ID,  External_Analytics_Data_Source_Field_ID
External_FieldObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

External_FieldObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Integration_Service_Component_Field_Over.description: To determine a value using an External Field, populate this element.

Integration_Service_Component_Override_D.description: Service Component Field Override Data element

validation.validation: Use the Next Sequence for Integration File Utility field for File Name when launching or scheduling the EIB.

description: Integration Service Component Override Data element
